sub_title: Master’s in Sustainable Energy Technology at Technische Universiteit Delft | ex Software Engineer at Bosch | ex Indian Space Research Organization(ISRO) | Data Science  | Climate |  Energy
summary:
As an electrical engineer, using technology to mitigate climate change has been one of the most challenging questions to answer. Over the last four years, I have tried answering this question by working on using machine learning and data science in the field of energy and climate. 

I have developed a wide variety of skills from my previous tech roles and from classes I am taking as a Master's student in Sustainable Energy Technology at Technische University Delft. Some of the courses I am taking include: Energy system optimisation, Intelligent Electrical Power Grids, DC and AC microgrids. 
 
I have previously worked in an ed-tech startup called Univ.AI, where I worked as a Research and Teaching fellow to build Machine Learning and Data Science courses. Before that, I worked as a Software Engineer at Bosch Engineering and Business Solutions. As a Software Engineer, I developed embedded software for air and pressure sensors for three-wheeler(specifically for the Indian market) and four-wheeler vehicles, which helped reduce vehicle emissions. 
I have interned in companies such as Power Research Development Consultants(PRDC) Pvt Ltd and Indian Space Research Organization (ISRO), where I learned about energy efficiency and renewable energy. 

If you have any questions or would like a copy of my resume, I'd love to connect!

projects.title: E-Mon: Energy Monitoring system for households
projects.description:
This project was a part of the course: IOT in Smart Cities and Campuses, offered by Centre of Continuing Education, Indian Institute of Science Bangalore.
About the project:
This project aims to develop an Energy Monitoring system for households in India, using the concept of Non - intrusive load monitoring. 

Highlights:
1. Received a grade A+ in the course and certification
2. Championed the development and presentation of a prototype for “Household Level Energy monitoring system, (E-Mon)” at PROTOFAIRE in Indian Institute of Science on 15th December 2018

contributors.headline: Master’s in Sustainable Energy Technology at Technische Universiteit Delft | ex Software Engineer at Bosch | ex Indian Space Research Organization(ISRO) | Data Science  | Climate |  Energy

projects.title: AI based generation scheduler for a smart micro grid
projects.description:
This project was done as a bachelor’s thesis and an internship in Power Research and Development Consultants Pvt Ltd. 

The aim of this project is to design a set of generalised algorithms for Energy Management System of a Micro-Grid.

The first algorithm is designed to reduce the uncertainty and variability of renewable energy sources. This task is accomplished by day ahead forecasting of the meteorological parameters which affect the generation using neural networks.

The second algorithm focuses on scheduling of generation sources by using an economic optimisation model considering multiple technical limitations. This is done by using multi-objective genetic algorithm to solve.

contributors.headline: Master’s in Sustainable Energy Technology at Technische Universiteit Delft | ex Software Engineer at Bosch | ex Indian Space Research Organization(ISRO) | Data Science  | Climate |  Energy

projects.title: Sun sensors for STUDSAT-2(Student satellite)
projects.description:
This project was carried out as research for the Student Satellite STUDSAT-2. The main aim of this project was to integrate Sun Sensors and use it for orientation of the satellite in space with various algorithms.

About the project:
One of the main subsystems of the satellite is Attitude Determination and Control Sub-System(ADCS).

The ADCS is responsible for the orientation of the satellite in space. It takes various celestial bodies as a reference to do so, such as the Earth, the Sun, the Stars and so on. A Sun Sensor is a device that senses the direction with respect to the Sun. This can be as simple as some solar cells. The Sun Sensors measure the solar energy falling on their surface and through internal electronics determine the angle made by the Sun with respect to the sensor, which in turn is used to arrive at the Sun vector which is then used to orient the satellite in space.

projects.title: LED based Sun Simulator
projects.description:
This project was carried out as an internship in Laboratory of Electro-Optic Systems, Indian Space Research Organisation.

The main objective of this project is to design an LED based sun simulator, which consumes lesser power and gives the same efficiency as any other sun simulator used in laboratories and covers AM1.5G solar spectrum.

profile_positions.description:
TU Delft Energy club is a student organization under Delft Energy Initiative, committed to bridge the gap between students interested in energy and industry, policy makers and researchers in the field of energy.
Highlights: 
Organizing events such as lectures, excursions, workshops in the field of energy and climate. 
Working on a community platform to provide energy enthusiasts across the world a place to brainstorm and collaborate.
profile_positions.title: Secretary

profile_positions.description:
Univ.AI is an EdTech startup aiming to provide, state of the art Artificial Intelligence education and building a distributed, global educational powerhouse that draws on technology, and the finest AI expertise. 

Highlights include:

1. Led a team of eight, for course development for Futureschool.AI – new venture aimed to provide education in the field of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Data Science to Indian students between the age of 14 to 17.
2. Constructed well-organized code to distribute to students for course modules; mentored students on data collection, analysis and visualization from basic to advanced level (ML-1 and ML-2 courses)
3. Built course modules and curriculum on machine learning, convolutional neural networks, data science - exploratory data analysis, and recommendation systems, with mentorship of 2 Harvard University professors.
4. Led lab sessions (hands-on coding), corrected work, and assisted with questions for 40-80 professional, graduate-level students for all artificial intelligence and data science course modules.
profile_positions.title: Research and Teaching Fellow | Project Lead | Technology

profile_positions.description:
Bosch Engineering and Business Solutions is one of the world’s leading global supplier of technology and services, in the field of Automotive, Energy and Consumer Appliances.

Highlights include:
1. Worked on development of embedded software for differential pressure sensors in three-wheeler vehicles for Indian Market, leading to the reduction of emissions produced by three-wheelers by at least 70%.
2. Produced and built software for pressure and mass flow sensors for Combustion Engines, to check for emissions of a vehicle.
profile_positions.title: Associate Software Engineer | Coding

company.name: Nitte Meenakshi Institute of Technology - STUDSAT2

profile_positions.description:
Project STUDSAT (STUDent SATellite) is a unique satellite technology endeavor undertaken by under-graduate students in Nitte Meenakshi Institute of Technology. The project demonstrates in-orbit inter-satellite separation and the inter-satellite communication link (ISL) between two satellites.

Highlights include: 
1. Designed and developed the position of Sun Sensors on the satellite, involving complete design, characterization and integration for both the twin nanosatellites.
2. Built the Sun Vector algorithm which provides the orientation of satellite in space using Sun as the reference.
profile_positions.title: Research Intern

company.name: Power Research and Development Consultants Pvt Ltd

profile_positions.company: Power Research and Development Consultants Pvt Ltd
profile_positions.description:
PRDC is a leading Power System Consulting Company in India, in the field of power system consulting, power system studies, analysis, design, planning and simulations.

Highlights include:
Bachelor Thesis | “Intelligent Generation Scheduler for a Smart Micro-Grid”. 1. Thesis led to proposal of a novel optimization algorithm for renewable microgrids with solar and wind as power generation sources.
2. Exhibited as a technical paper at the 2nd International Conference on Energy Power and Environment in Shillong, Meghalaya in June 2018, submitted to the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE).
3. Accolades achieved include Best Project award at the Project Exhibition in Nitte Meenakshi Institute of Technology, Bangalore (April 2018) and Best Project Award from Visvesvaraya Technological University (VTU) (July 2018).
profile_positions.title: Project Intern | Renewable Energy Division

profile_positions.description:
Indian Space Research Organization is the national space agency of India. LEOS is a part of ISRO, which is involved in design, development and production of Electro-Optic sensors and camera optics for
satellites and launch vehicles.

Highlights include:
1. Lead Developer in the design and development of India’s first Light-Emitting Diode (LED) based Sun Simulator, a compact size device that consumes 99% less power compared to traditional Halogen or Xenon Lamp based Simulators.
